problem_text:
Conjecture: Suppose that G is a non-abelian simple group and H is a finite
group such that Cod(G) = Cod(H). Then G ∼= H.
Comment of 2025: The conjecture is proved for G of type PSL(2, q) (A. Bahri,
Z. Akhlaghi, B. Khosravi, Bull. Austral. Math. Soc., 104, no. 2 (2021), 278–286);
PSL(3, q) or PSU(3, q) (Y. Liu, Y. Yang, Results Math., 78, no. 1 (2023), article No. 7);
a sporadic simple group (M. Dolorfino, L. Martin, Z. Slonim, Y. Sun, Y. Yang, Bull.
Austral. Math. Soc., 109, no. 1 (2024), 57–66); an alternating group (M. Dolorfino,
L. Martin, Z. Slonim, Y. Sun, Y. Yang, Bull. Austral. Math. Soc., 110, no. 1 (2024),
115–120);
2F4(q2) (Y. Yang, J. Group Theory, 27, no. 1 (2024), 141–155); PSL(n, q)
or a simple exceptional group of Lie type (H. P. Tong Viet, Math. Nachr., 298, no. 4
(2025), 1356–1369).
G. Qian
